title: Behavior of a function from first derivative table

content.question: Let f be a polynomial function with values of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B29@</annotation> </semantics> </math> at selected values of x given in the table above. Which of the following must be true for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C25@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

choices.label: The graph of f is concave up.
The graph of f has at least two points of inflection.
f has at least two relative extrema.

content.answer: The graph of f has at least two points of inflection.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
